resources.name: comma delimited primary names on the Consolidated Sanctions List
Consolidated Sanctions List (Non-SDN Lists)
resources.description:
Last Updated: 08/02/2022

In order to make it easier to comply with OFAC's sanctions regulations, the office is now offering all of its non-SDN sanctions lists in a consolidated set of data files "the Consolidated Sanctions List".  These consolidated files comply with all OFAC's existing data standards.  In the future, if OFAC creates a new non-SDN style list, the office will add the new data associated with that list to these consolidated data files if appropriate.  While the consolidated sanctions list data files are not part of OFAC's list of [Specially Designated Nationals and Blocked Persons "the SDN List,"](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/specially-designated-nationals-and-blocked-persons-list-sdn-human) the records in these consolidated files may also appear on the SDN List.

[Information About OFAC's Sanctions List Search Tools](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/sanctions-list-search-tool)

### Hash Values for List Content Assurance

-   [SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-516 hash values for OFAC list files](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/specially-designated-nationals-list-sdn-list/hash-values-for-ofac-sanctions-list-files)

### Included in the Consolidated Sanctions List Data Files:

-   [Non-SDN Chinese Military-Industrial Complex Companies List (NS-CMIC List)](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/consolidated-sanctions-list/ns-cmic-list)

### ARCHIVED SANCTIONS LIST INFORMATION:

### **Guidance:**

-   [Definition of OFAC program tags](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/specially-designated-nationals-list-sdn-list/program-tag-definitions-for-ofac-sanctions-lists) 

### **DATA CENTER - Consolidated List - formatted for information processing**

| File Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [CONSALL.ZIP](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/consall.zip "Zip file containing ASCII delimited Unix/Linux-ready CSV") | Contains 21 files in a ZIP archive (archive includes CSV, @ sign delimited, fixed-width delimited, and XML versions of the Consolidated Sanctions list) |
| [CONS\_ADVANCED.XML](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/sanctions/1.0/cons_advanced.xml) | XML version of the Consolidated list that conforms to the advanced data standard developed by the UN 1267/1988 Security Council Committee.  For more information, please see [FAQs](https://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/SDN-List/Pages/advanced_faq.aspx).  |
| [CONSOLIDATED.XML](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/consolidated.xml) | XML version of the Consolidated Sanctions list |
| [CONS\_PRIM.DEL](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_prim.del "This link opens in a new window.") | @ sign delimited primary names on the Consolidated Sanctions List |
| [CONS\_ADD.DEL](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_add.del "This link opens in a new window.") | @ sign delimited addresses (links to CONS\_PRIM.DEL and CONS\_ALT.DEL) |
| [CONS\_ALT.DEL](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_alt.del "This link opens in a new window.") | @ sign delimited alternate (aka) names (links to CONS\_ADD.DEL and CONS\_PRIM.DEL) |
| [CONS\_COMMENTS.DEL](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_comments.del) | @ sign delimited "spill over" files containing remarks data that exceeds the 1000 character limit in the CONS\_PRIM.DEL file.  |
| [CONS\_PRIM.FF](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_prim.ff "This link opens in a new window.") | fixed-width primary names on the Consolidated Sanctions List |
| [CONS\_ADD.FF](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_add.ff "This link opens in a new window.") | fixed-width addresses (links to CONS\_PRIM.FF and CONS\_ALT.FF) |
| [CONS\_ALT.FF](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_alt.ff "This link opens in a new window.") | fixed-width alternate (aka) names (links to CONS\_ADD.FF and CONS\_PRIM.FF) |
| [CONS\_COMMENTS.FF](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_comments.ff) | fixed-width "spill over" files containing remarks data that exceeds the 1000 character limit in the CONS\_PRIM.FF file.  |
| [CONS\_PRIM.CSV](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_prim.csv "This link opens in a new window.") | comma delimited primary names on the Consolidated Sanctions List |
| [CONS\_ADD.CSV](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_add.csv "This link opens in a new window.") | comma delimited addresses (links to CONS\_PRIM.CSV and CONS\_ALT.CSV) |
| [CONS\_ALT.CSV](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_alt.csv "This link opens in a new window.") | comma delimited alternate (aka) names (links to CONS\_ADD.CSV and CONS\_PRIM.CSV) |
| [CONS\_COMMENTS.CSV](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_comments.csv) | comma delimited "spill over" files containing remarks data that exceeds the 1000 character limit in the CONS\_PRIM.CSV file.  |
| [CONS\_PRIM.PIP](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_prim.pip "This link opens in a new window.") | "|" (pipe) character delimited primary names on the Consolidated Sanctions List |
| [CONS\_ADD.PIP](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_add.pip "This link opens in a new window.") | "|" (pipe) character delimited addresses (links to CONS\_PRIM.PIP and CONS\_ALT.PIP) |
| [CONS\_ALT.PIP](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_alt.pip "This link opens in a new window.") | "|" (pipe) character delimited alternate (aka) names (links to CONS\_ADD.PIP and CONS\_PRIM.PIP) |
| [CONS\_COMMENTS.PIP](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/consolidated/cons_comments.pip) | "|" (pipe) character delimited "spill over" files containing remarks data that exceeds the 1000 character limit in the CONS\_PRIM.PIP file.  |

XML version of the Consolidated Sanctions list
Sectoral Sanctions Identifications (SSI) List
resources.description:
Last Updated: 08/02/2022

[Sign up for SSI List e-mail updates.](http://service.govdelivery.com/service/subscribe.html?code=USTREAS_1024)

[Subscribe to the OFAC RSS feed (includes notices of SSI List updates).](https://home.treasury.gov/system/files/126/ofac.xml)

OFAC publishes a list to identify persons operating in sectors of the Russian economy identified by the Secretary of the Treasury pursuant to [Executive Order 13662](https://home.treasury.gov/system/files/126/ukraine_eo3.pdf). [Directives](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/sanctions-programs-and-country-information/ukraine-russia-related-sanctions#directives) found within the list describe prohibitions on dealings with the persons identified.

The SSI List is not part of the Specially Designated Nationals (SDN) List. However, individuals and companies on the SSI List may also appear on the SDN List.

### Search OFAC's Sanctions Lists (Including the SSI List)

### Complete SSI List:

-   [Complete Sectoral Sanctions Identifications List (PDF format)](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/ssi/ssilist.pdf "SSI List (PDF Format) - This link opens in a new window.")
-   [Complete Sectoral Sanctions Identifications List (TEXT format)](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/ssi/ssilist.txt "SSI List (Text Format) - This link opens in a new window.") 

### Changes to the SSI List:

-   [What changed on the list when it was last updated (PDF format)?](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/ssi/ssinew22.pdf "What Changed on last update - This link opens in a new window.")
    
-   [What changed on the list when it was last updated? (TEXT format)](https://www.treasury.gov/ofac/downloads/ssi/ssinew22.txt)
    
-   [Archive of changes to the SSI List](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/specially-designated-nationals-list-sdn-list/archive-of-changes-to-the-sdn-list#ssi)
    

### Guidance and Resources:

-   [Frequently asked questions (FAQs) related to Sectoral Sanctions Identifications, including information on dealings with SSIs](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/faqs/topic/1576)
-   [FAQs related to entities owned by persons whose property and interests in property are blocked (50% Rule)](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/faqs/topic/1521)
-   [Alias Screening for OFAC Sanctions Lists](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/recent-actions/20110121)
-   [Additional information regarding Ukraine-/Russia-related Sanctions](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/sanctions-programs-and-country-information/ukraine-russia-related-sanctions)

### How to Download a Data Formatted Version of the SSI List:

-   To download a data formatted (e.g. XML, CSV) version of the SSI List, please see the [Consolidated Sanctions List page](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/consolidated-sanctions-list-data-files). The SSI List data is included with all of OFAC's other non-SDN lists in the Consolidated list.

### Other OFAC Sanctions Lists:

-   [Specially Designated Nationals (SDN) List](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/specially-designated-nationals-and-blocked-persons-list-sdn-human-readable-lists)
-   [See additional non-SDN Sanctions Lists](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/other-ofac-sanctions-lists)

### How to be Removed from a Sanctions List:

-   [Click here to appeal an OFAC designation or other listing](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/specially-designated-nationals-list-sdn-list/filing-a-petition-for-removal-from-an-ofac-list)

resources.name: Foreign Sanctions Evaders (FSE) List
resources.description:
Last Updated: 05/11/2021

[Sign up for FSE List e-mail updates.](https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/USTREAS/subscriber/new?topic_id=USTREAS_1003 "Sign up for Foreign Sanctions Evaders (FSE) List e-mail updates")

[Subscribe to the OFAC RSS feed (includes notices of FSE List updates).](https://home.treasury.gov/system/files/126/ofac.xml "OFAC Really Simple Syndication Feed")

OFAC publishes a list of foreign individuals and entities determined to have violated, attempted to violate, conspired to violate, or caused a violation of U.S. sanctions on Syria or Iran pursuant to [Executive Order 13608.](https://home.treasury.gov/system/files/126/fse_eo.pdf) It also lists foreign persons who have facilitated deceptive transactions for or on behalf of persons subject to U.S. sanctions. Collectively, such individuals and companies are called “Foreign Sanctions Evaders” or “FSEs.” Transactions by U.S. persons or within the United States involving FSEs are prohibited.

The FSE List is not part of the Specially Designated Nationals (SDN) List. However, individuals and companies on the FSE List may also appear on the SDN List.

### **Search OFAC's Sanctions Lists (Including the FSE List)**

-   FSE List targets will appear in OFAC's Sanctions List Search tool with the program tag beginning with "FSE-" and "Non-SDN" as the list type.
    

### **Complete FSE List:**

### **Changes to the FSE List:**

### **Guidance and Resources:**

### **How to Download a Data Formatted Version of the FSE List:**

-   To download a data formatted (e.g. XML, CSV) version of the FSE List, please see the [Consolidated Sanctions List page.](https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/financial-sanctions/consolidated-sanctions-list-data-files) The FSE List data is included with all of OFAC's other non-SDN lists in the Consolidated list.
    

### **Other OFAC Sanctions Lists:** 

### **How to be Removed from a Sanctions List:**

resources.description:
